title: The new plugin `@truffle/dashboard-hardhat-plugin` breaks with `Error: spawn npx ENOENT`
body:
## Issue

I wanted to add the new Truffle plugin `@truffle/dashboard-hardhat-plugin` to my Hardhat project template [here](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/hardhat-project-template-ts). However, this will break all my scripts with the following error:

```bash
$ npx hardhat run --network truffle-dashboard scripts/deploy.ts
Error: spawn npx ENOENT
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:282:19)
    at onErrorNT (node:internal/child_process:480:16)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:83:21)
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.

---

$ npx hardhat test
Error: spawn npx ENOENT
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:282:19)
    at onErrorNT (node:internal/child_process:480:16)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:83:21)
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.

---

$ npx hardhat run --network hardhat scripts/deploy.ts
Error: spawn npx ENOENT
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:282:19)
    at onErrorNT (node:internal/child_process:480:16)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:83:21)
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

## Steps to Reproduce

Clone my repository [here](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/hardhat-project-template-ts/tree/main) and enable `import "@truffle/dashboard-hardhat-plugin";` in my `hardhat.config.ts`. Thereafter, run e.g. `yarn test:hh` or `yarn deploy:hh`.

## Expected Behavior

It should not break and work smoothly. To be clear, I can use smoothly the Truffle dashboard without the plugin, so that works as intended. Just importing the new plugin breaks it, unfortunately.

## Actual Results

See above in the summary.

## Environment

* Operating System: Windows
* Ethereum client:
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): `v5.8.0 (core: 5.8.0)`
* node version (`node --version`): `v16.0.0`
* npm version (`npm --version`): `8.19.3`

@pcaversaccio , Thanks for raising this. I couldn't reproduce this on OS X Ventura 13.2.1, Node 16 and Node 18. Unfortunately I won't have access to a windows machine for a few days.

```console
$ truffle version
Truffle v5.8.0 (core: 5.8.0)
Ganache v7.7.6
Solidity v0.5.16 (solc-js)
Node v18.12.1
Web3.js v1.8.2

$ git log -1
Sat Mar 11 13:01:12 2023 +0100 e379e6a (HEAD -> main, origin/main, origin/HEAD) ♻️ forge build flag fix  [Pascal Marco Caversaccio]%

$ git diff | bat
───────┬──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
       │ STDIN
───────┼──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   1   │ diff --git i/hardhat.config.ts w/hardhat.config.ts
   2   │ index 86074cc..a187e31 100644
   3   │ --- i/hardhat.config.ts
   4   │ +++ w/hardhat.config.ts
   5   │ @@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ import "@nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers";
   6   │  import "@nomicfoundation/hardhat-chai-matchers";
   7   │  import "@nomiclabs/hardhat-etherscan";
   8   │  import "@typechain/hardhat";
   9   │ -// import "@truffle/dashboard-hardhat-plugin";
  10   │ +import "@truffle/dashboard-hardhat-plugin";
  11   │  import "xdeployer";
  12   │  import "hardhat-gas-reporter";
  13   │  import "solidity-coverage";
───────┴──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

$ yarn test:hh
yarn run v1.22.19
$ npx hardhat test
2023-03-11 19:21:47.816 WARN Service =>Tenderly config doesn't exist, empty string values are returned instead.
2023-03-11 19:21:47.839 WARN Service =>Tenderly config doesn't exist, empty string values are returned instead.
Preparing Truffle compilation
Sending Truffle compilation to dashboard
Compilation successfully sent!
 ·------------------------|---------------------------|----------------·
 |  Solc version: 0.8.19  ·  Optimizer enabled: true  ·  Runs: 999999  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Contract Name         ·  Size (KiB)               ·  Change (KiB)  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Create2               ·                    0.084  ·         0.000  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Create2Deployer       ·                    3.003  ·         0.000  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Create2DeployerLocal  ·                    3.003  ·         0.000  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  ERC1820Implementer    ·                    0.295  ·         0.000  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Greeter               ·                    1.105  ·         0.000  │
 ·------------------------|---------------------------|----------------·


  Greeter
    ✔ Should return the new greeting once it's changed (465ms)
    ✔ Should mine the given number of blocks


  2 passing (469ms)

✨  Done in 3.73s.

```
@cds-amal in order to isolate the problem, I also tested it via `Ubuntu 20.04.5 LTS` and for that one, it works as well. So it's a Windows-specific issue.

It's gotta be something about how the @truffle/from-hardhat (compatibility package under the hood) invokes `npx hardhat` in a child process on Windows. There's probably some difference that we weren't aware of.

Should hopefully be easy to figure out and fix.
@gnidan cool - let me know if you need further information to reproduce it correctly.

> @gnidan cool - let me know if you need further information to reproduce it correctly.

Thanks! @cds-amal and I are planning to pair on this on Monday. We'll update here!

@pcaversaccio, I tried  with Windows 11, node 18 and encountered an error related to `xdeployer` with `@truffle/dashboard-hardhat-plugin` uncommented as per your instructions ; see error below. However, I was on an old version of truffle and, after upgrading to truffle@5.8.0, ~I am unable to reproduce.~ it still fails, but does not include information about `xdeployer`; I wonder if the dashboard-hardhat-plugin is eating the error. 

~Can you confirm you're on the latest truffle version (5.8.0)?~ I'll continue investigating tomorrow. Thanks again!

Edit: oops - I was careless with reproduction steps.

```console
C:\Users\cdssu\dev\hardhat-project-template-ts>yarn test:hh
yarn run v1.22.19
$ npx hardhat test
√ Help us improve Hardhat with anonymous crash reports & basic usage data? (Y/n) · n
2023-03-12 18:45:36.353 WARN Service =>Tenderly config doesn't exist, empty string values are returned instead.
2023-03-12 18:45:36.554 WARN Service =>Tenderly config doesn't exist, empty string values are returned instead.
Downloading compiler 0.8.19
Warning: "selfdestruct" has been deprecated. The underlying opcode will eventually undergo breaking changes, and its use is not recommended.
  --> xdeployer/src/contracts/Create2Deployer.sol:98:9:
   |
98 |         selfdestruct(payoutAddress);
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^


Compiled 9 Solidity files successfully
Error: spawn npx ENOENT
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:283:19)
    at onErrorNT (node:internal/child_process:476:16)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:82:21)
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

@cds-amal that's actually my own hardhat plugin lol :-D. Yes I can confirm am on the latest version:

```bash
Truffle v5.8.0 (core: 5.8.0)
Ganache v7.7.6
Solidity v0.5.16 (solc-js)
Node v16.0.0
Web3.js v1.8.2
```

The output you see here is not an error but a warning from the Solidity compiler since I use the latest Solidity version `0.8.19` and the Solidity compiler deprecated the `selfdestruct` opcode since version [`0.8.18`](https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/releases/tag/v0.8.18).

> TypeChecker: Warn when using deprecated builtin `selfdestruct`.

There is underlying reason why this warning is issued since I use in `xdeployer` under the hood my [`Create2Deployer`](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/create2deployer) which uses itself the `selfdestruct` opcode due to some legacy reasons. This should not be the one that triggers this error.

I tested it now with Ubuntu & Debian and both work (including `xdeployer`). The source code for `xdeployer` is [here](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/xdeployer/blob/main/src/index.ts). It's nothing fancy tbh...

Hypothesis: Windows Node.js having trouble finding `npx` via `child_process.spawn`. 

We might need to switch `npx hardhat console` inside @truffle/from-hardhat to the more direct `node -r hardhat/register`. I believe that's all `npx hardhat console` does, anyway, and hopefully `node` is easier to find on the PATH.

Edit: not sure what we'll do about `npx hardhat --version`, though, which happens first ([here](https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/blob/develop/packages/from-hardhat/src/ask-hardhat.ts#L36)). I guess look for the HH package.json and just read that?

FYI, @cds-amal's and my schedules aren't aligning today to pair on this. I might try to get a Windows environment set up so I can reproduce by myself, but if not, he and I have time on the calendar tomorrow. Hoping to get a fix out in this week's release (probably Thursday)
thanks for the heads-up - am currently anyways busy with the Euler Finance exploit...

> thanks for the heads-up - am currently anyways busy with the Euler Finance exploit...

hope the impact isn't too severe for you!

> hope the impact isn't too severe for you!

I'm supporting on the security side of things. I'm personally not impacted, fortunately.
@cds-amal I also found `shell: true` and that was the very thing I was going to suggest we try!
FYI @pcaversaccio the above change will go out tomorrow in our weekly release, so this plugin will hopefully start working for you on Windows then!
@gnidan and @cds-amal awesome - thx for the swift support by you guys! Will confirm here after testing the released version.

Hey @pcaversaccio @truffle/dashboard-hardhat-plugin@0.1.1 just got released. Want to try it out?

Thanks for reporting this and bearing with us as we got this fixed!
@gnidan thx for the heads-up. I'm travelling over the next couple of days. I will try to give feedback on Tuesday/Wednesday.

> @gnidan thx for the heads-up. I'm travelling over the next couple of days. I will try to give feedback on Tuesday/Wednesday.

Sounds good. Enjoy the weekend!

> Hey @pcaversaccio @truffle/dashboard-hardhat-plugin@0.1.1 just got released. Want to try it out?
> 

I verified it on a Windows machine.

@gnidan @cds-amal I can confirm that it works now but I get a weird `undici` bug now:

```bash
PS C:\Dev\Blockchain\hardhat-project-template-ts> yarn deploy:dashboard
yarn run v1.22.19
$ npx hardhat run --network truffle-dashboard scripts/deploy.ts
Preparing Truffle compilation
Sending Truffle compilation to dashboard
Compilation successfully sent!
 ·------------------------|---------------------------|----------------·
 |  Solc version: 0.8.19  ·  Optimizer enabled: true  ·  Runs: 999999  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Contract Name         ·  Size (KiB)               ·  Change (KiB)  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Create2               ·                    0.084  ·         0.000  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Create2Deployer       ·                    2.864  ·         0.000  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Create2DeployerLocal  ·                    2.864  ·         0.000  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  ERC1820Implementer    ·                    0.295  ·         0.000  │
 ·························|···························|·················
 |  Greeter               ·                    1.105  ·         0.000  │
 ·------------------------|---------------------------|----------------·
HeadersTimeoutError: Headers Timeout Error
    at Timeout.onParserTimeout [as callback] (C:\Dev\Blockchain\hardhat-project-template-ts\node_modules\hardhat\node_modules\undici\lib\client.js:906:28)
    at Timeout.onTimeout [as _onTimeout] (C:\Dev\Blockchain\hardhat-project-template-ts\node_modules\hardhat\node_modules\undici\lib\timers.js:18:13)
    at listOnTimeout (node:internal/timers:557:17)
    at processTimers (node:internal/timers:500:7) {
  code: 'UND_ERR_HEADERS_TIMEOUT'
}
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

To be clear, I'm able to use the dashboard and also get the additional data. I'm not sure what causes this issue - without the plugin I never saw that one using the Truffle dashboard.
How strange, @pcaversaccio. I did not encounter that error when I tested on windows. Is it consistent?

@pcaversaccio it's a guess, but can you add `timeout: 0` to your `networks["truffle-dashboard"]` configuration? I believe Hardhat's default is 20 seconds, which might not be enough time for you to alt-tab and confirm in MetaMask.

@cds-amal yes consistently.

@gnidan your guess was right - `timeout: 0` resolved it. Maybe something to add for the docs?
FYI I quickly looked it up, the default is 40 seconds for the localhost and 20 seconds for any other network.

> your guess was right - timeout: 0 resolved it. Maybe something to add for the docs?

Awesome! Great thinking. Opened an issue on our docs repo to start.

> Question is now, whether this is something you can fix on your end (since you allow for MM interactions via the plugin and not HH).

~~Oof, that looks like a nonce mismatch. Maybe try resetting your MetaMask accounts? I think it's somewhere in the advanced settings. This does not strike me as something wrong on the Truffle Dashboard side, but just in case, how many signatures did you make for that one transaction... just the one?~~ **Edit:** Nevermind I didn't know what you meant at first by "speed up the transaction". Now that I understand, I think there's nothing we can do. Hardhat is probably not designed to expect a second transaction hash :/.

> (Sorry for abusing this already resolved issue for another one)

I'm happy to bend the rules a bit here since we're all used to getting the email notifications on this issue :) But if we do surface more clear bugs, then maybe we should at least open new issues for those.

Here's a thought though: we could add a setting to Truffle Dashboard that causes it to wait for confirmation before sending the provider response. Then you could replace the transaction as many times as you like, and Hardhat should only ever learn about the very last one. This would definitely require `timeout: 0`, of course.

I'll write that issue up later today... not sure how easy it'd be to implement.

> Here's a thought though: we could add a setting to Truffle Dashboard that causes it to wait for confirmation before sending the provider response.

I actually like the idea! The question is whether I described an edge case that is worth the complexity of course. I just like playing around sometimes with the intention to break things ;-).

Since everything is resolved in this issue or will be documented in separate issues, I will close it accordingly. Thanks a lot for your support!
